trans-unit.source: Custom date and time format strings
trans-unit.target: 自定义日期和时间格式字符串

trans-unit.source: A date and time format string defines the text representation of a [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) or [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value that results from a formatting operation .
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间格式字符串定义由格式设置操作生成的 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 或 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值的文本表示形式。

trans-unit.source: It can also define the representation of a date and time value that is required in a parsing operation in order to successfully convert the string to a date and time.
trans-unit.target: 它还可定义分析操作中需要的日期和时间值的表示形式，以便成功将字符串转换为日期和时间。

trans-unit.source: A custom format string consists of one or more custom date and time format specifiers.
trans-unit.target: 自定义格式字符串由一个或多个自定义日期和时间格式说明符组成。

trans-unit.source: Any string that is not a [standard date and time format string](standard-datetime.md) is interpreted as a custom date and time format string.
trans-unit.target: 任何不是[标准日期和时间格式字符串](standard-datetime.md)的字符串都会解释为自定义日期和时间格式字符串。

trans-unit.source: Custom date and time format strings can be used with both [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) and [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values.
trans-unit.target: 自定义日期和时间格式字符串可以与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 和 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值一起使用。

trans-unit.source: In formatting operations, custom date and time format strings can be used either with the `ToString` method of a date and time instance or with a method that supports composite formatting.
trans-unit.target: 在格式设置操作中，可将自定义日期和时间格式字符串与日期和时间实例的 `ToString` 方法或支持复合格式的方法结合使用。

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates both uses.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例演示了这两种用法。

trans-unit.source: In parsing operations, custom date and time format strings can be used with the [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), [DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@)), [DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), and [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@)) methods.
trans-unit.target: 在分析操作中，自定义日期和时间格式字符串可用于 [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider))、[DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@))、[DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)) 和 [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@)) 方法。

trans-unit.source: These methods require that an input string conform exactly to a particular pattern for the parse operation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: 这些方法需要一个完全符合使分析操作成功所需的特定模式的输入字符串。

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates a call to the [DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(String, String, IFormatProvider)](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)) method to parse a date that must include a day, a month, and a two-digit year.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例演示对 [DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(String, String, IFormatProvider)](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)) 方法的调用，以分析必须包括日、月和两位数年份的日期。

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the custom date and time format specifiers and displays a result string produced by each format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 下表描述自定义日期和时间格式说明符并显示由每个格式说明符生成的结果字符串。

trans-unit.source: By default, result strings reflect the formatting conventions of the en-US culture.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，结果字符串反映 zh-cn 区域性的格式设置约定。

trans-unit.source: If a particular format specifier produces a localized result string, the example also notes the culture to which the result string applies.
trans-unit.target: 如果特定格式说明符生成本地化结果字符串，则该示例还注明结果字符串适用的区域性。

trans-unit.source: See the Notes section for additional information about using custom date and time format strings.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用自定义日期和时间格式字符串的附加信息，请参见注释部分。

trans-unit.source: With [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values: `2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Unspecified ->`; `2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Utc -> Z`; `2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Local -> -07:00 (depends on local computer settings)`; With [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values: `2019-06-15T01:45:30-07:00 --> -07:00`; `2019-06-15T08:45:30+00:00 --> +00:00`
trans-unit.target: 具有 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值：`2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Unspecified ->`；`2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Utc -> Z`；`2019-06-15T13:45:30, Kind Local -> -07:00 (depends on local computer settings)`；具有 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值：`2019-06-15T01:45:30-07:00 --> -07:00`；`2019-06-15T08:45:30+00:00 --> +00:00`

trans-unit.target: 将下面的字符定义为自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.target: 转义字符。

trans-unit.source: Any other character

trans-unit.source: The character is copied to the result string unchanged.
trans-unit.target: 字符将复制到未更改的结果字符串。

trans-unit.source: The following sections provide additional information about each custom date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 以下各节提供有关每个自定义日期和时间格式说明符的附加信息。

trans-unit.source: Unless otherwise noted, each specifier produces an identical string representation regardless of whether it is used with a [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) value or a [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value.
trans-unit.target: 除非另行说明，否则，每个说明符将生成相同的字符串表示形式，这与它是与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用还是与 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值一起使用无关。

trans-unit.source: The "d" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “d”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "d" custom format specifier represents the day of the month as a number from 1 through 31.
trans-unit.target: “d”自定义格式说明符将一个月中的某一天表示为从 1 到 31 的数字。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit day is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数的日期设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "d" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "d" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“d”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“d”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "d" custom format specifier in several format strings.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在几个格式字符串中包含“d”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "dd" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “dd”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "dd" custom format string represents the day of the month as a number from 01 through 31.
trans-unit.target: “dd”自定义格式字符串将一个月中的某一天表示为从 01 到 31 的数字。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit day is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数的日期设置为带有前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "dd" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“dd”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "ddd" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “ddd”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "ddd" custom format specifier represents the abbreviated name of the day of the week.
trans-unit.target: “ddd”自定义格式说明符表示一周中某天的缩写名称。

trans-unit.source: The localized abbreviated name of the day of the week is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames) property of the current or specified culture.
trans-unit.target: 一周中某天的本地化缩写名称通过当前或指定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "ddd" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“ddd”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "dddd" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “dddd”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "dddd" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "d" specifiers) represents the full name of the day of the week.
trans-unit.target: “dddd”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“d”说明符）表示一周中某天的完整名称。

trans-unit.source: The localized name of the day of the week is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.DayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.DayNames) property of the current or specified culture.
trans-unit.target: 一周中某天的本地化名称通过当前或指定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.DayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.DayNames) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "dddd" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“dddd”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "f" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “f”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "f" custom format specifier represents the most significant digit of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the tenths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “f”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的最高有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的十分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: If the "f" format specifier is used without other format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "f" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“f”格式说明符而没有其他格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“f”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: When you use "f" format specifiers as part of a format string supplied to the [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), [DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@)), [DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), or [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@) ) method, the number of "f" format specifiers indicates the number of most significant digits of the seconds fraction that must be present to successfully parse the string.
trans-unit.target: 当使用作为格式字符串的一部分提供给 [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider))、[DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@))、[DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)) 或 [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@) ) 方法的“f”格式说明符时，所用的“f”格式说明符的数目指示为成功分析字符串而必须呈现的秒部分的最高有效位的数目。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "f" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“f”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "ff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “ff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "ff" custom format specifier represents the two most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the hundredths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “ff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前两个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的百分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "ff" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“ff”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "fff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “fff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "fff" custom format specifier represents the three most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the milliseconds in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “fff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前三个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的毫秒。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "fff" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“fff”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "ffff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “ffff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "ffff" custom format specifier represents the four most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the ten thousandths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “ffff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前四个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the ten thousandths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "fffff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “fffff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "fffff" custom format specifier represents the five most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the hundred thousandths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “fffff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前五个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的十万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the hundred thousandths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的十万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "ffffff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “ffffff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "ffffff" custom format specifier represents the six most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the millionths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “ffffff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前六个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的百万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the millionths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的百万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "fffffff" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “fffffff”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "fffffff" custom format specifier represents the seven most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the ten millionths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “fffffff”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前七个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的千万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the ten millionths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的千万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "F" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “F”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "F" custom format specifier represents the most significant digit of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the tenths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “F”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的最高有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的十分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: Nothing is displayed if the digit is zero.
trans-unit.target: 如果该数字为零，则不显示任何内容。

trans-unit.source: If the "F" format specifier is used without other format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "F" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“F”格式说明符而没有其他格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“F”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The number of "F" format specifiers used with the [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), [DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@)), [DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)), or [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@) ) method indicates the maximum number of most significant digits of the seconds fraction that can be present to successfully parse the string.
trans-unit.target: 用于 [DateTime.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider))、[DateTime.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTime@))、[DateTimeOffset.ParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)) 或 [DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact](xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles,System.DateTimeOffset@) ) 方法的“F”格式说明符的数目指示为成功分析字符串而可以呈现的秒部分的最高有效位的最大数目。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "F" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“F”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "FF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FF" custom format specifier represents the two most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the hundredths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前两个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的百分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or two zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或两个零位。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "FF" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“FF”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "FFF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FFF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FFF" custom format specifier represents the three most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the milliseconds in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FFF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前三个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的毫秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or three zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或三个零位。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "FFF" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“FFF”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "FFFF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FFFF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FFFF" custom format specifier represents the four most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the ten thousandths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FFFF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前四个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or four zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或四个零位。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the ten thousandths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FFFFF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFF" custom format specifier represents the five most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the hundred thousandths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FFFFF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前五个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的十万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or five zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或五个零位。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the hundred thousandths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的十万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFFF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FFFFFF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFFF" custom format specifier represents the six most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the millionths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FFFFFF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前六个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的百万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or six zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或六个零位。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the millionths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的百万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFFFF" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “FFFFFFF”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "FFFFFFF" custom format specifier represents the seven most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the ten millionths of a second in a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “FFFFFFF”自定义格式说明符表示秒部分的前七个有效位；也就是说，它表示日期和时间值的千万分之几秒。

trans-unit.source: However, trailing zeros or seven zero digits are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: 但不显示尾随零或七个零位。

trans-unit.source: Although it is possible to display the ten millionths of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以显示时间值的秒部分的千万分之几秒，但是该值可能并没有意义。

trans-unit.source: The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间值的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: The "g" or "gg" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “g”或“gg”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "g" or "gg" custom format specifiers (plus any number of additional "g" specifiers) represents the period or era, such as A.D.
trans-unit.target: “g”或“gg”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“g”说明符）表示时期或纪元（例如 A.D）。

trans-unit.source: The formatting operation ignores this specifier if the date to be formatted does not have an associated period or era string.
trans-unit.target: 如果要设置格式的日期没有关联的时期或纪元字符串，则格式设置操作将忽略此说明符。

trans-unit.source: If the "g" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "g" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“g”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“g”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "g" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“g”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "h" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “h”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "h" custom format specifier represents the hour as a number from 1 through 12; that is, the hour is represented by a 12-hour clock that counts the whole hours since midnight or noon.
trans-unit.target: “h”自定义格式说明符将小时表示为从 1 至 12 的数字，即采用 12 小时制表示小时，自午夜或中午开始对整小时计数。

trans-unit.source: A particular hour after midnight is indistinguishable from the same hour after noon.
trans-unit.target: 午夜后经过的某特定小时数与中午过后的相同小时数无法加以区分。

trans-unit.source: The hour is not rounded, and a single-digit hour is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 小时数不进行舍入，一位数字的小时数设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: For example, given a time of 5:43 in the morning or afternoon, this custom format specifier displays "5".
trans-unit.target: 例如，给定上午或下午时间为 5:43，则此自定义格式说明符显示“5”。

trans-unit.source: If the "h" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“h”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "h" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“h”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "hh" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “hh”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "hh" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "h" specifiers) represents the hour as a number from 01 through 12; that is, the hour is represented by a 12-hour clock that counts the whole hours since midnight or noon.
trans-unit.target: “hh”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“h”说明符）将小时表示为从 01 至 12 的数字，即采用 12 小时制表示小时，自午夜或中午开始对整小时计数。

trans-unit.source: A particular hour after midnight is indistinguishable from the same hour after noon.
trans-unit.target: 午夜后经过的某特定小时数与中午过后的相同小时数无法加以区分。

trans-unit.source: The hour is not rounded, and a single-digit hour is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 小时数不进行舍入，一位数字的小时数设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: For example, given a time of 5:43 in the morning or afternoon, this format specifier displays "05".
trans-unit.target: 例如，给定上午或下午时间为 5:43，则此格式说明符显示“05”。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "hh" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“hh”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "H" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “H”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "H" custom format specifier represents the hour as a number from 0 through 23; that is, the hour is represented by a zero-based 24-hour clock that counts the hours since midnight.
trans-unit.target: “H”自定义格式说明符将小时表示为从 0 至 23 的数字，即通过从零开始的 24 小时制表示小时，自午夜或中午开始对整小时计数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit hour is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的小时数设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "H" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“H”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "H" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“H”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "HH" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “HH”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "HH" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "H" specifiers) represents the hour as a number from 00 through 23; that is, the hour is represented by a zero-based 24-hour clock that counts the hours since midnight.
trans-unit.target: “HH”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“H”说明符）将小时表示为从 00 至 23 的数字，即通过从零开始的 24 小时制表示小时，自午夜或中午开始对整小时计数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit hour is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的小时数设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "HH" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“HH”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "K" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “K”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "K" custom format specifier represents the time zone information of a date and time value.
trans-unit.target: “K”自定义格式说明符表示日期和时间值的时区信息。

trans-unit.source: When this format specifier is used with [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values, the result string is defined by the value of the [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property:
trans-unit.target: 当此格式说明符与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用时，结果字符串由 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性的值进行定义：

trans-unit.source: For the local time zone (a [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property value of [DateTimeKind.Local](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Local), this specifier is equivalent to the "zzz" specifier and produces a result string containing the local offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC); for example, "-07:00".
trans-unit.target: 对于本地时区（[DateTimeKind.Local](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Local) 的 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性值），此说明符等效于“zzz”说明符，并产生一个包含相对于协调世界时 (UTC) 的本地偏移量的结果字符串，例如“-07:00”。

trans-unit.source: For a UTC time (a [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property value of [DateTimeKind.Utc](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Utc)), the result string includes a "Z" character to represent a UTC date.
trans-unit.target: 对于 UTC 时间（[DateTimeKind.Utc](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Utc) 的 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性值），结果字符串包含用于表示 UTC 日期的“Z”字符。

trans-unit.source: For a time from an unspecified time zone (a time whose [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property equals [DateTimeKind.Unspecified](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Unspecified)), the result is equivalent to [String.Empty](xref:System.String#System_String_Empty).
trans-unit.target: 对于未指定时区的时间（其 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性等于 [DateTimeKind.Unspecified](xref:System.DateTimeKind.Unspecified) 的时间），结果等效于 [String.Empty](xref:System.String#System_String_Empty)。

trans-unit.source: For [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values, the "K" format specifier is equivalent to the "zz" format specifier, and produces a result string containing the [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value's offset from UTC.
trans-unit.target: 对于 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值，“K”格式说明符等效于“zz”格式说明符，并产生包含 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值相对于 UTC 的偏移量的结果字符串。

trans-unit.source: If the "K" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“K”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example displays the string that results from using the "K" custom format specifier with various [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) and [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values on a system in the U.S. Pacific Time zone.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例显示对美国太平洋时区中的系统上的各种 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 和 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值使用“K”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "m" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “m”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "m" custom format specifier represents the minute as a number from 0 through 59.
trans-unit.target: “m”自定义格式说明符将分钟表示为从 0 到 59 的数字。

trans-unit.source: The minute represents whole minutes that have passed since the last hour.
trans-unit.target: 分钟表示自上一小时以来经过的整分钟数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit minute is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的分钟数设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "m" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "m" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“m”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“m”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "m" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“m”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "mm" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “mm”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "mm" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "m" specifiers) represents the minute as a number from 00 through 59.
trans-unit.target: “mm”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“m”说明符）将分钟表示为从 00 到 59 的数字。

trans-unit.source: The minute represents whole minutes that have passed since the last hour.
trans-unit.target: 分钟表示自上一小时以来经过的整分钟数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit minute is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的分钟数设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "mm" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“mm”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "M" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “M”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "M" custom format specifier represents the month as a number from 1 through 12 (or from 1 through 13 for calendars that have 13 months).
trans-unit.target: “M”自定义格式说明符将月份表示为从 1 到 12 的数字（对于有 13 个月的日历，将月份表示为从 1 到 13 的数字）。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit month is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的月份数设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "M" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "M" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“M”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“M”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "M" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“M”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "MM" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “MM”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "MM" custom format specifier represents the month as a number from 01 through 12 (or from 1 through 13 for calendars that have 13 months).
trans-unit.target: “MM”自定义格式说明符将月份表示为从 01 到 12 的数字（对于有 13 个月的日历，将月份表示为从 1 到 13 的数字）。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit month is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的月份数设置为带有前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "MM" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“MM”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "MMM" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “MMM”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "MMM" custom format specifier represents the abbreviated name of the month.
trans-unit.target: “MMM”自定义格式说明符表示月份的缩写名称。

trans-unit.source: The localized abbreviated name of the month is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthNames) property of the current or specified culture.
trans-unit.target: 月份的本地化缩写名称通过当前或指定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthNames) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "MMM" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“MMM”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "MMMM" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “MMMM”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "MMMM" custom format specifier represents the full name of the month.
trans-unit.target: “MMMM”自定义格式说明符表示月份的完整名称。

trans-unit.source: The localized name of the month is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames) property of the current or specified culture.
trans-unit.target: 月份的本地化名称通过当前或指定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "MMMM" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“MMMM”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "s" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “s”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "s" custom format specifier represents the seconds as a number from 0 through 59.
trans-unit.target: “s”自定义格式说明符将秒表示为从 0 到 59 的数字。

trans-unit.source: The result represents whole seconds that have passed since the last minute.
trans-unit.target: 结果表示自上一分钟以来经过的整秒数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit second is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的秒数设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "s" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "s" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“s”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“s”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "s" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“s”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "ss" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “ss”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "ss" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "s" specifiers) represents the seconds as a number from 00 through 59.
trans-unit.target: “ss”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“s”说明符）将秒表示为从 00 到 59 的数字。

trans-unit.source: The result represents whole seconds that have passed since the last minute.
trans-unit.target: 结果表示自上一分钟以来经过的整秒数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit second is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的秒数设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "ss" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“ss”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "t" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “t”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "t" custom format specifier represents the first character of the AM/PM designator.
trans-unit.target: “t”自定义格式说明符表示 AM/PM 指示符的第一个字符。

trans-unit.source: The appropriate localized designator is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator) or [DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator) property of the current or specific culture.
trans-unit.target: 相应的本地化指示符通过当前或特定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator) 或 [DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The AM designator is used for all times from 0:00:00 (midnight) to 11:59:59.999.
trans-unit.target: AM 指示符用于自 0:00:00（午夜）到 11:59:59.999 的所有时间。

trans-unit.source: The PM designator is used for all times from 12:00:00 (noon) to 23:59:59.999.
trans-unit.target: PM 指示符用于自 12:00:00（中午）到 23:59:59.999 的所有时间。

trans-unit.source: If the "t" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "t" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“t”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“t”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "t" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“t”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "tt" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “tt”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "tt" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "t" specifiers) represents the entire AM/PM designator.
trans-unit.target: “tt”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“t”说明符）表示整个 AM/PM 指示符。

trans-unit.source: The appropriate localized designator is retrieved from the [DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator) or [DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator) property of the current or specific culture.
trans-unit.target: 相应的本地化指示符通过当前或特定区域性的 [DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AMDesignator) 或 [DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.PMDesignator) 属性进行检索。

trans-unit.source: The AM designator is used for all times from 0:00:00 (midnight) to 11:59:59.999.
trans-unit.target: AM 指示符用于自 0:00:00（午夜）到 11:59:59.999 的所有时间。

trans-unit.source: The PM designator is used for all times from 12:00:00 (noon) to 23:59:59.999.
trans-unit.target: PM 指示符用于自 12:00:00（中午）到 23:59:59.999 的所有时间。

trans-unit.source: Make sure to use the "tt" specifier for languages for which it is necessary to maintain the distinction between AM and PM.
trans-unit.target: 对于需要维护 AM 与 PM 之间的差异的语言，应确保使用“tt”说明符。

trans-unit.source: An example is Japanese, for which the AM and PM designators differ in the second character instead of the first character.
trans-unit.target: 以日语为例，其 AM 和 PM 指示符的差异点为第二个字符，而非第一个字符。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "tt" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“tt”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "y" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “y”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "y" custom format specifier represents the year as a one-digit or two-digit number.
trans-unit.target: “y”自定义格式说明符将年份表示为一位或两位数字。

trans-unit.source: If the year has more than two digits, only the two low-order digits appear in the result.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份多于两位数，则结果中仅显示两位低位数。

trans-unit.source: If the first digit of a two-digit year begins with a zero (for example, 2008), the number is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 如果两位数字的年份的第一个数字以零开始（例如，2008），则该数字设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "y" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as the "y" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“y”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为“y”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "y" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“y”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "yy" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “yy”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "yy" custom format specifier represents the year as a two-digit number.
trans-unit.target: “yy”自定义格式说明符将年份表示为一位或两位数字。

trans-unit.source: If the year has more than two digits, only the two low-order digits appear in the result.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份多于两位数，则结果中仅显示两位低位数。

trans-unit.source: If the two-digit year has fewer than two significant digits, the number is padded with leading zeros to produce two digits.
trans-unit.target: 如果两位数年份的有效数字少于两个，则用前导零填充该数字以产生两位数。

trans-unit.source: In a parsing operation, a two-digit year that is parsed using the "yy" custom format specifier is interpreted based on the [Calendar.TwoDigitYearMax](xref:System.Globalization.Calendar.TwoDigitYearMax) property of the format provider's current calendar.
trans-unit.target: 在分析操作中，使用“yy”自定义格式说明符分析的两位数年份是基于格式提供程序的当前日历的 [Calendar.TwoDigitYearMax](xref:System.Globalization.Calendar.TwoDigitYearMax) 属性被释义的。

trans-unit.source: The following example parses the string representation of a date that has a two-digit year by using the default Gregorian calendar of the en-US culture, which, in this case, is the current culture.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例通过使用默认 zh-cn 区域性（在这种情况下为当前区域性）的公历来分析具有二位数年份的日期的字符串表示形式。

trans-unit.source: It then changes the current culture's [CultureInfo](xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo) object to use a [GregorianCalendar](xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar) object whose [TwoDigitYearMax](xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar.TwoDigitYearMax) property has been modified.
trans-unit.target: 然后，它更改当前区域的 [CultureInfo](xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo) 对象，以便使用其 [TwoDigitYearMax](xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar.TwoDigitYearMax) 属性已更改的 [GregorianCalendar](xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar) 对象。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "yy" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“yy”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "yyy" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “yyy”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "yyy" custom format specifier represents the year with a minimum of three digits.
trans-unit.target: “yyy”自定义格式说明符至少使用三位数字表示年份。

trans-unit.source: If the year has more than three significant digits, they are included in the result string.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份的有效数字多于三个，则将它们包括在结果字符串中。

trans-unit.source: If the year has fewer than three digits, the number is padded with leading zeros to produce three digits.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份少于三位数，则用前导零填充该数字以产生三位数。

trans-unit.source: For the Thai Buddhist calendar, which can have five-digit years, this format specifier displays all significant digits.
trans-unit.target: 对于年份可以为五位数的泰国佛历，此格式说明符将显示全部有效数字。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "yyy" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“yyy”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "yyyy" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “yyyy”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "yyyy" custom format specifier represents the year with a minimum of four digits.
trans-unit.target: “yyyy”自定义格式说明符至少使用四位数字表示年份。

trans-unit.source: If the year has more than four significant digits, they are included in the result string.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份的有效数字多于四个，则将它们包括在结果字符串中。

trans-unit.source: If the year has fewer than four digits, the number is padded with leading zeros to produce four digits.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份少于四位数，则用前导零填充该数字使其达到四位数。

trans-unit.source: For the Thai Buddhist calendar, which can have five-digit years, this format specifier displays all significant digits.
trans-unit.target: 对于年份可以为五位数的泰国佛历，此格式说明符将显示全部有效数字。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "yyyy" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“yyyy”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "yyyyy" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “yyyyy”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "yyyyy" custom format specifier (plus any number of additional "y" specifiers) represents the year with a minimum of five digits.
trans-unit.target: “yyyyy”自定义格式说明符（以及任意数量的附加“y”说明符）最少将年份表示为五位数字。

trans-unit.source: If the year has more than five significant digits, they are included in the result string.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份的有效数字多于五个，则将它们包括在结果字符串中。

trans-unit.source: If the year has fewer than five digits, the number is padded with leading zeros to produce five digits.
trans-unit.target: 如果年份少于五位数，则用前导零填充该数字以产生五位数。

trans-unit.source: If there are additional "y" specifiers, the number is padded with as many leading zeros as necessary to produce the number of "y" specifiers.
trans-unit.target: 如果存在额外的“y”说明符，则用所需个数的前导零填充该数字以产生“y”说明符的数目。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "yyyyy" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“yyyyy”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "z" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “z”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: With [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values, the "z" custom format specifier represents the signed offset of the local operating system's time zone from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), measured in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用时，“z”自定义格式说明符表示本地操作系统的时区相对于协调世界时 (UTC) 的有符号偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: It does not reflect the value of an instance's [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property.
trans-unit.target: 它不反映一个实例的 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性的值。

trans-unit.source: For this reason, the "z" format specifier is not recommended for use with [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values.
trans-unit.target: 出于此原因，不建议将“z”格式说明符与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用。

trans-unit.source: With [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values, this format specifier represents the [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value's offset from UTC in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值一起使用时，此格式说明符表示 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值相对于 UTC 的偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: The offset is always displayed with a leading sign.
trans-unit.target: 偏移量始终显示为带有前导符号。

trans-unit.source: A plus sign (+) indicates hours ahead of UTC, and a minus sign (-) indicates hours behind UTC.
trans-unit.target: 加号 (+) 指示早于 UTC 的小时数，减号 (-) 指示晚于 UTC 的小时数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit offset is formatted without a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的偏移量设置为不带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: If the "z" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“z”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "z" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“z”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "zz" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “zz”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: With [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values, the "zz" custom format specifier represents the signed offset of the local operating system's time zone from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), measured in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用时，“zz”自定义格式说明符表示本地操作系统的时区相对于协调世界时 (UTC) 的有符号偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: It does not reflect the value of an instance's [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property.
trans-unit.target: 它不反映一个实例的 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性的值。

trans-unit.source: For this reason, the "zz" format specifier is not recommended for use with [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values.
trans-unit.target: 出于此原因，不建议将“zz”格式说明符与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用。

trans-unit.source: With [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values, this format specifier represents the [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value's offset from UTC in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值一起使用时，此格式说明符表示 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值相对于 UTC 的偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: The offset is always displayed with a leading sign.
trans-unit.target: 偏移量始终显示为带有前导符号。

trans-unit.source: A plus sign (+) indicates hours ahead of UTC, and a minus sign (-) indicates hours behind UTC.
trans-unit.target: 加号 (+) 指示早于 UTC 的小时数，减号 (-) 指示晚于 UTC 的小时数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit offset is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的偏移量设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "zz" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“zz”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The "zzz" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “zzz”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: With [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values, the "zzz" custom format specifier represents the signed offset of the local operating system's time zone from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), measured in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用时，“zzz”自定义格式说明符表示本地操作系统的时区相对于协调世界时 (UTC) 的有符号偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: It does not reflect the value of an instance's [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) property.
trans-unit.target: 它不反映一个实例的 [DateTime.Kind](xref:System.DateTime.Kind) 属性的值。

trans-unit.source: For this reason, the "zzz" format specifier is not recommended for use with [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) values.
trans-unit.target: 出于此原因，不建议将“zzz”格式说明符与 [DateTime](xref:System.DateTime) 值一起使用。

trans-unit.source: With [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) values, this format specifier represents the [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) value's offset from UTC in hours.
trans-unit.target: 与 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值一起使用时，此格式说明符表示 [DateTimeOffset](xref:System.DateTimeOffset) 值相对于 UTC 的偏移量（以小时为单位）。

trans-unit.source: The offset is always displayed with a leading sign.
trans-unit.target: 偏移量始终显示为带有前导符号。

trans-unit.source: A plus sign (+) indicates hours ahead of UTC, and a minus sign (-) indicates hours behind UTC.
trans-unit.target: 加号 (+) 指示早于 UTC 的小时数，减号 (-) 指示晚于 UTC 的小时数。

trans-unit.source: A single-digit offset is formatted with a leading zero.
trans-unit.target: 一位数字的偏移量设置为带前导零的格式。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the "zzz" custom format specifier in a custom format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在一个自定义格式字符串中包含“zzz”自定义格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: The ":" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “:”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The ":" custom format specifier represents the time separator, which is used to differentiate hours, minutes, and seconds.
trans-unit.target: “:”自定义格式说明符表示时间分隔符，它用于区分小时、分钟和秒。

trans-unit.source: If the ":" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“:”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: The "/" custom format specifier
trans-unit.target: “/”自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: The "/" custom format specifier represents the date separator, which is used to differentiate years, months, and days.
trans-unit.target: “/”自定义格式说明符表示日期分隔符，它用于区分年、月和日。

trans-unit.source: If the "/" format specifier is used without other custom format specifiers, it is interpreted as a standard date and time format specifier and throws a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用“/”格式说明符而没有其他自定义格式说明符，则将该说明符解释为标准日期和时间格式说明符，并引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For more information about using a single format specifier, see [Using single custom format specifiers](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: 有关使用单个格式说明符的更多信息，请参见此主题后面的[使用单个自定义格式说明符](#using-single-custom-format-specifiers)。

trans-unit.source: Character literals
trans-unit.target: 字符文本

trans-unit.source: The following characters in a custom date and time format string are reserved and are always interpreted as formatting characters or, in the case of ", ', /, and \, as special characters.
trans-unit.target: 自定义日期和时间格式字符串中的以下字符是保留的字符，始终解释为格式字符，但 "、’、/ 和 \, 解释为特殊字符。

trans-unit.source: F
trans-unit.target: F

trans-unit.source: H
trans-unit.target: H

trans-unit.source: K
trans-unit.target: K

trans-unit.source: M
trans-unit.target: M

trans-unit.source: d
trans-unit.target: d

trans-unit.source: f
trans-unit.target: f

trans-unit.source: g
trans-unit.target: g

trans-unit.source: h
trans-unit.target: h

trans-unit.source: m
trans-unit.target: m

trans-unit.source: s
trans-unit.target: 秒

trans-unit.source: y
trans-unit.target: y

trans-unit.source: y
trans-unit.target: y

trans-unit.source: z
trans-unit.target: z

trans-unit.source: All other characters are always interpreted as character literals and, in a formatting operation, are included in the result string unchanged.
trans-unit.target: 所有其他字符始终解释为字符文本，在格式设置操作中，将按原样包含在结果字符串中。

trans-unit.source: In a parsing operation, they must match the characters in the input string exactly; the comparison is case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: 在分析操作中，这些字符必须与输入字符串中的字符完全匹配；比较时区分大小写。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the literal characters "PST" (for Pacific Standard Time) and "PDT" (for Pacific Daylight Time) to represent the local time zone in a format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在格式字符串中包含用于表示时区的文本字符“PST”（太平洋标准时间）和“PDT”（太平洋夏令时）。

trans-unit.source: Note that the string is included in the result string, and that a string that includes the local time zone string also parses successfully.
trans-unit.target: 请注意，该字符串将包含在结果字符串中，并且包含本地时区字符串的字符串也可成功完成分析。

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to indicate that characters are to be interpreted as literal characters and not as reserve characters, so that they can be included in a result string or successfully parsed in an input string:
trans-unit.target: 可通过两种方法来指示要将字符解释为文本字符而不是保留字符，以便这些字符可以包含在结果字符串中，或者在输入字符串中成功完成分析：

trans-unit.source: By escaping each reserved character.
trans-unit.target: 通过转义每个保留字符。

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using the escape character](#using-the-escape-character).
trans-unit.target: 有关详细信息，请参阅[使用转义字符](#using-the-escape-character)。

trans-unit.source: The following example includes the literal characters "pst" (for Pacific Standard time) to represent the local time zone in a format string.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例在格式字符串中包含用于表示时区的文本字符“pst”（太平洋标准时间）。

trans-unit.source: Because both "s" and "t" are custom format strings, both characters must be escaped to be interpreted as character literals.
trans-unit.target: 由于“s”和“t”都是自定义格式字符串，因此这两个字符必须经过转义才能解释为字符文本。

trans-unit.source: By enclosing the entire literal string in quotation marks or apostrophes.
trans-unit.target: 通过将整个文本字符串括在双引号或单引号中。

trans-unit.source: The following example is like the previous one, except that "pst" is enclosed in quotation marks to indicate that the entire delimited string should be interpreted as character literals.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例与前一个示例类似，不过，pst 括在引号中，指示应将整个分隔字符串解释为字符文本。

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: 备注

trans-unit.source: Using single custom format specifiers
trans-unit.target: 使用单个自定义格式说明符

trans-unit.source: A custom date and time format string consists of two or more characters.
trans-unit.target: 自定义日期和时间格式字符串由两个或更多字符组成。

trans-unit.source: Date and time formatting methods interpret any single-character string as a standard date and time format string.
trans-unit.target: 日期和时间格式设置方法将任何单字符字符串解释标准日期和时间格式字符串。

trans-unit.source: If they do not recognize the character as a valid format specifier, they throw a [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException).
trans-unit.target: 如果它们无法将该字符识别为有效格式说明符，则会引发 [FormatException](xref:System.FormatException)。

trans-unit.source: For example, a format string that consists only of the specifier "h" is interpreted as a standard date and time format string.
trans-unit.target: 例如，仅包含说明符“h”的格式字符串解释为标准日期和时间格式字符串。

trans-unit.source: However, in this particular case, an exception is thrown because there is no "h" standard date and time format specifier.
trans-unit.target: 但是，在此特定情况下将引发异常，原因是不存在“h”标准日期和时间格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: To use any of the custom date and time format specifiers as the only specifier in a format string (that is, to use the "d", "f", "F", "g", "h", "H", "K", "m", "M", "s", "t", "y", "z", ":", or "/" custom format specifier by itself), include a space before or after the specifier, or include a percent ("%") format specifier before the single custom date and time specifier.
trans-unit.target: 若要将任何自定义日期和时间格式说明符作为格式字符串中的唯一说明符使用（即若要使用“d”、“f”、“F”、“g”、“h”、“H”、“K”、“m”、“M”、“s”、“t”、“y”、“z”、“:”或“/”自定义格式说明符自身），请在该说明符之前或之后添加一个空格，或在单个自定义日期和时间说明符之前包括一个百分号（“%”）格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: For example, "`%h`" is interpreted as a custom date and time format string that displays the hour represented by the current date and time value.
trans-unit.target: 例如，“`%h`”将解释为一个自定义日期和时间格式字符串，用于显示当前日期和时间值表示的小时。

trans-unit.source: You can also use the " h" or "h " format string, although this includes a space in the result string along with the hour.
trans-unit.target: 也可以使用“ h”或“h ”格式字符串，尽管它在结果字符串及小时中包含一个空格。

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates these three format strings.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例阐释了这三个格式字符串。

trans-unit.source: Using the escape character
trans-unit.target: 使用转义字符

trans-unit.source: The "d", "f", "F", "g", "h", "H", "K", "m", "M", "s", "t", "y", "z", ":", or "/" characters in a format string are interpreted as custom format specifiers rather than as literal characters.
trans-unit.target: 格式字符串中的“d”、“f”、“F”、“g”、“h”、“H”、“K”、“m”、“M”、“s”、“t”、“y”、“z”、“:”或“/”字符被解释为自定义格式说明符而不是文本字符。

trans-unit.source: To prevent a character from being interpreted as a format specifier, you can precede it with a backslash (\), which is the escape character.
trans-unit.target: 若要防止某个字符被解释为格式说明符，可以在该字符前面加上反斜杠（\)，即转义字符）。

trans-unit.source: The escape character signifies that the following character is a character literal that should be included in the result string unchanged.
trans-unit.target: 转义字符表示以下字符为应包含在未更改的结果字符串中的字符文本。

trans-unit.source: To include a backslash in a result string, you must escape it with another backslash (`\\`).
trans-unit.target: 若在要结果字符串中包括反斜杠，必须使用另一个反斜杠 (`\\`) 对其转义。

trans-unit.source: Some compilers, such as the C# compiler, may also interpret a single backslash character as an escape character.
trans-unit.target: 一些编译器（如 C# 编译器）也可能会将单个反斜杠字符解释为转义字符。

trans-unit.source: To ensure that a string is interpreted correctly when formatting, you can use the verbatim string literal character (the @ character) before the string, or add another backslash character before each backslash.
trans-unit.target: 若要确保在设置格式时正确解释字符串，可以在字符串之前使用原义字符串文本字符（@ 字符），或者在每个反斜杠之前另外添加一个反斜杠字符。

trans-unit.source: The following C# example illustrates both approaches.
trans-unit.target: 下面的 C# 示例阐释了这两种方法。

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the escape character to prevent the formatting operation from interpreting the "h" and "m" characters as format specifiers.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例使用转义字符，以防止格式设置操作将“h”和“m”字符解释为格式说明符。

trans-unit.source: DateTimeFormatInfo properties
trans-unit.target: DateTimeFormatInfo 属性

trans-unit.source: Formatting is influenced by properties of the current [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) object, which is provided implicitly by the current thread culture or explicitly by the [IFormatProvider](xref:System.IFormatProvider) parameter of the method that invokes formatting.
trans-unit.target: 格式化受当前的 [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) 对象的属性影响，其由当前线程区域性隐式提供或由调用格式化的方法的 [IFormatProvider](xref:System.IFormatProvider) 参数显式提供。

trans-unit.source: For the [IFormatProvider](xref:System.IFormatProvider) parameter, you should specify a [CultureInfo](xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo) object, which represents a culture, or a [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) object.
trans-unit.target: 对于 [IFormatProvider](xref:System.IFormatProvider) 参数，应指定一个表示区域性的 [CultureInfo](xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo) 对象或指定一个 [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) 对象。

trans-unit.source: The result string produced by many of the custom date and time format specifiers also depends on properties of the current [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) object.
trans-unit.target: 由许多自定义日期和时间格式说明符产生的结果字符串还取决于当前的 [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) 对象的属性。

trans-unit.source: Your application can change the result produced by some custom date and time format specifiers by changing the corresponding [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) property.
trans-unit.target: 应用程序通过更改相应的 [DateTimeFormatInfo](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo) 属性，可以改变由某些自定义日期和时间格式说明符产生的结果。

trans-unit.source: For example, the "ddd" format specifier adds an abbreviated weekday name found in the [AbbreviatedDayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames) string array to the result string.
trans-unit.target: 例如，“ddd”格式说明符将在 [AbbreviatedDayNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedDayNames) 字符串数组中找到的缩写的星期名称添加到结果字符串。

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the "MMMM" format specifier adds a full month name found in the [MonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames) string array to the result string.
trans-unit.target: 类似地，"MMMM"格式说明符将在 [MonthNames](xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthNames) 字符串数组中找到的月的完整名称添加到结果字符串。
